config.question: What forced the United States to shift from a position of studied neutrality to a position of all-out aid to the Allied forces in Europe?

choices.content: the surrender of the Allied forces to the Germans after only four days
the abortive attempt by the Germans to attack American bases in Hawaii
the fear of the Atlantic becoming the highway for Germany into America
the attack on American cargo ships by the German air force in the Atlantic

answer_2.response: Consider This: The German forces had captured Denmark, Norway, Netherlands, Belgium, Luxembourg, and France in a matter of four weeks. This left the British as the only nation standing between the Germans and the Americans. See L.O. 27.2 The Road to War.
